title: Early Childhood
vision: All New Haven children, birth through age 8, will be healthy, safe, thriving in nurturing families, and prepared to be successful, lifelong learners

targets.name: Access to pre-K
targets.content: Increase the percentage of New Haven children with pre-K experience from 73.9% to 100%

targets.name: Quality teaching
targets.content: Increase the percentage of preschool teachers meeting state credential requirements from 70% to 100%

targets.name: Families and caregivers
targets.content: Expand parenting education and support efforts to reach 60% of parents of young children

definitions.definition: A student is considered chronically absent if they miss at least 10% of school days for any reason.
Low-income means a person lives in a household with an income of less than 2 times the federal poverty level.
Pre-K enrollment is measured as the share of children ages 3 and 4 enrolled in some type of school.
